metadata.Title: CVE-2011-1749 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The nfs_addmntent function in support/nfs/nfs_mntent.c in the mount.nsf tool in nfs-utils before 1.2.4 attempts to append to the /etc/mtab file without first checking whether resource limits would interfere, which allows local users to corrupt this file via a process with a small RLIMIT_FSIZE value, a related issue to CVE-2011-1089.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-1749` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

nfs-common - 1:1.2.8-6ubuntu1
nfs-kernel-server - 1:1.2.8-6ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nfs-utils package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.2.8-6ubuntu1').
